thread.title: Former Maypearl Police Chief Sentenced To 40 Years
thread.title_full: Former Maypearl Police Chief Sentenced To 40 Years

author: CBS Dallas / Fort Worth
title: Former Maypearl Police Chief Sentenced To 40 Years
text:
ELLIS COUNTY (KRLD) – An Ellis County court sentenced former Maypearl Police Chief Kevin Coffey to 40 years in prison on Tuesday. BREAKING: Former Maypearl police chief Kevin Coffey gets 40 years in prison for sexual assault of child, indecency @KRLD @CBSDFW 
— Austin York (@realAustinYork) February 21, 2017 
A jury found Coffey guilty on two charges related to his sexual relationship with a 14-year-old girl. 
Coffey was found guilty on a count of sexual contact of a minor and another count of sexual assault of a minor. 
Investigators first started looking into the allegations in 2015. 
It was reportedly a relationship that involved Coffey exposing himself, having online video chats with and sexually touching the teen. 
In at least one situation the former police chief, allegedly grabbed the girl’s hair and kissed her, before inappropriately touching her.
